metadata.synopsis: Withers has orgized a party for all the players/origins 6 months after the conclusion of destroying the Netherbrain. He is being his typical cryptic self.

10.speaker: Withers
10.text: Thou feelst it still. She is not here. She who was the boldest.

113.speaker: Withers
113.text: Hast thy thoughts been with brave Karlach often?

24.speaker: Player
24.text: I loved her so much. It isn't fair.

51.speaker: Player
51.text: I'm so grateful for the time we had together.

4.speaker: Withers
4.text: In but a dozen tendays, an entire life was lived. More than mortal years. Mortal centuries were hers.

42.speaker: Withers
42.text: Her life, her happiness, was you.

61.speaker: Withers
61.text: Thy life was hers for a while. It is now thine again. Live it well.

18.speaker: Player
18.text: I think I'm going to cry.

123.speaker: Withers
123.text: It is your right to weep. There comes a day in each mortal life, when a soul has shed its final tear.

44.speaker: Withers
44.text: For saying such, she wouldst have picked thee up, and thrown thee at me, leaving us both prone.

7.speaker: Player
7.text: I wish we could have cured her... fixed her... stopped this somehow.

37.speaker: Withers
37.text: Thou brought joy to the dark of her last hours. It was the greatest gift thou could have given.

81.speaker: Player
81.text: I don't know how I can go on without her.

132.speaker: Withers
132.text: She battled in Avernus, fuelled on naught but hope. And that hope came to become truth.

111.speaker: Withers
111.text: Thou might endure a great aeon of mourning. But thou must hope, as once she did.

8.speaker: Player
8.text: I'm being strong. It's what she would have wanted.

94.speaker: Withers
94.text: Truly? Most of the time, it was she who was strong for thee.

110.speaker: Withers
110.text: Didst thou not employ her ever to carry all of thine loot?

62.speaker: Withers
62.text: It is said that mortals require levity, that it is the antidote to any of the darkest hours.

93.speaker: Withers
93.text: And who knew that better than she?

103.speaker: Player
103.text: She was everything... always putting herself between us and any danger.

2.speaker: Player
2.text: The world feels cold without her.

11.speaker: Withers
11.text: Thou art safe and warm because of her, even if her mortal fire has gone out.

50.speaker: Withers
50.text: Thy band, thy bond, gave that life to her.

99.speaker: Player
99.text: I wanted my friends to be my new family. She was like a sister to me.

17.speaker: Player
17.text: She was like a sister to me...

29.speaker: Withers
29.text: Not like. Thou wert her kin. It was written in her heart. Surely thou knowest that?

20.speaker: Player
20.text: And I'm so glad she was in my life, too.

52.speaker: Withers
52.text: In the Fugue Plane, her soul burns so bright, it pains the gods to look upon.

122.speaker: Withers
122.text: Recall that in time, all changeth and all is rejoined. Thou shalt be with her again.

112.speaker: Player
112.text: I suppose I'll return to the party.

5.speaker: Player
5.text: I think I've caught up with everyone. What comes next?

128.speaker: Withers
128.text: What indeed. Prick up thy ears and listen.

131.speaker: Player
131.text: We should celebrate that, shouldn't we? Not mourn what wasn't.

114.speaker: Withers
114.text: Now, thou speakest like me. Thou hast wisdom, after all.

57.speaker: Player
57.text: It was scary how many goblin clubs she could carry.

91.speaker: Withers
91.text: With thee, she couldst do anything.

21.speaker: Player
21.text: The world is so much worse for her being gone. There was no one like her.

30.speaker: Withers
30.text: Correct. Not in planes material, elemental, nor transitive can her like be found.

35.speaker: Player
35.text: I can't think about her. It makes me too sad, each time.

0.speaker: Withers
0.text: To leave thy burden unspoken is to leave thyself burdened.

16.speaker: Withers
16.text: Thou searchest for the strongest warrior amongst thine band. Lae'zel, who ascended to the stars.

95.speaker: Player
95.text: My heart aches for her. I should have gone to the stars.

119.speaker: Withers
119.text: The gate of her heart closed to you. In the earth or in the stars, it would have mattered not.

130.speaker: Withers
130.text: It is as she wished. It is as all githyanki wish.

72.speaker: Withers
72.text: I askt thee once: what is the value of a single life?

68.speaker: Withers
68.text: Hast thou e'er pondered: what is the value of one mortal life?

118.speaker: Withers
118.text: For many of the gith, it can be measured: a single evening's supper for the Lich Queen. To be ascended is to be consumed.

22.speaker: Player
22.text: How dare you speak that way of Vlaakith's gift?

55.speaker: Withers
55.text: And yet, when the journey to the Astral Plane was offered to you, you hesitated.

56.speaker: Player
56.text: Lae'zel is cunning. She wouldn't have let that happen.

25.speaker: Player
25.text: I was powerless to stop her... but I wanted to.

108.speaker: Withers
108.text: Vlaakith's hunger has known the heads of fifty thousand of her subjects.

121.speaker: Withers
121.text: But Lae'zel was, perhaps, greater than the rest.

120.speaker: Player
120.text: The githyanki are practical. She is more use to Vlaakith alive.

90.speaker: Player
90.text: A pair of fried frog legs, eh?

97.speaker: Withers
97.text: Thine Urge was cured, if thou recallst. Thou need not say such things.

109.speaker: Withers
109.text: I know not where Lae'zel of K'liir is. I cannot sense her presence.

98.speaker: Player
98.text: What you say of her fate is true. I have known it since I was a hatchling. Somewhere deep within.

79.speaker: Withers
79.text: Thou art wise. But thou, of rebellious mind, must live in fear of thy queen. Lae'zel knew no fear.

36.speaker: Player
36.text: I should try to find her.

116.speaker: Withers
116.text: For her, it would have been wonderful.

84.speaker: Player
84.text: I won't believe this. It can't be true.

86.speaker: Withers
86.text: Are there any creatures blinder than the githyanki?

60.speaker: Withers
60.text: Surely thou art wise to thine own flaws?

39.speaker: Withers
39.text: Know this: her courage never faltered, her soul never waned. She accomplished all she e'er sought out.

59.speaker: Withers
59.text: If she had fallen in battle, she would never have known regret. If she had been killed in her duty, she would have known herself true.

67.speaker: Withers
67.text: If Vlaakith claimed her, it was Lae'zel's honour to be claimed.

75.speaker: Player
75.text: Well, she got what she deserved.

48.speaker: Player
48.text: Only a joke. Bhaal-me would have been salivating by now.

49.speaker: Player
49.text: I'm sure she is fighting with honour for her Queen.

71.speaker: Player
71.text: You summoned others from different planes. Why isn't she here?

12.speaker: Player
12.text: She isn't the kind to say goodbye, is she?

82.speaker: Withers
82.text: She has ascended. She is beyond.

27.speaker: Withers
27.text: Thou feelst it still. She is not here. She who means the most.

58.speaker: Withers
58.text: This one night is like any other... and yet... different.

69.speaker: Withers
69.text: Thou art the saviour of Baldur's Gate... until such time it requires saving again. How dost thou feel?

106.speaker: Player
106.text: I'm just glad to have a break from the Hells. It's the little things.

19.speaker: Player
19.text: I'm not sure. Happy to be alive, I guess.

46.speaker: Withers
46.text: I am pleased to hear it. The satisfaction of one's intention is, to my surprise, a rare accomplishment.

77.speaker: Player
77.text: I'm proud. You gave me a new life, another chance. I did my best with it.

78.speaker: Player
78.text: I feel satisfied. I accomplished everything I wanted to do.

76.speaker: Player
76.text: I did only what the Blade is sworn to do.

104.speaker: Player
104.text: I only protected the city from myself, and my Father.

26.speaker: Player
26.text: I did my duty. No more, no less.

117.speaker: Withers
117.text: Thou givest thyself so little credit. The duty borne by you was great - you could have well shirked.

31.speaker: Withers
31.text: Thou gavest what it was possible to give. The realm continues for your sacrifices.

53.speaker: Withers
53.text: Enjoy the revelry of the day; thou deservest at least that much.

126.speaker: Player
126.text: I can't help but feel some things have been left undone.

125.speaker: Withers
125.text: If thou could only see the paths of fate untaken, thy mind would surely break. Be glad of thy chosen path. It is, after all, thine.

3.speaker: Player
3.text: I'm getting tired... I might just go to bed.

1.speaker: Player
1.text: I'm getting tired... I might just go to bed.

66.speaker: Withers
66.text: Surely thou thinkest not of sleep on this eve of celebration?

41.speaker: Withers
41.text: For sleep will ever find thee, but thou may not see thy friends again until the end of days.

105.speaker: Withers
105.text: So I ask thee - how dost thou feel, apart from tired?

88.speaker: Player
88.text: Exhausted. The Council has run through many nights. I need to catch up on my sleep.

6.speaker: Player
6.text: Gale is the true saviour. Though I can't help but wonder if there wasn't another way...
